1. This road sign means:
2. The driver is about to:
3. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the left side of the road.
column6: straight down the middle of the road.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: towards the right side of the road.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: the road may be slippery when wet.
column8: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 5. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column6: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
7. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: tell the pedestrian where to cross the street.
column6: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.
column8: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.
column10: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.

column2: 8. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
9. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column6: It is not recommended to check

column2: 10. Warning signs are normally:
11. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
12. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 13. If a vehicle starts to skid on water the driver should quickly apply the brakes.
14. Driving at night requires increased caution because:
15. This road sign means:
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 16. Yellow traffic signs:
column10: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column6: A road joins from the left

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 19. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column6: pass the car on the left.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 20. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
column6: proceed because you have the right-of-way.
column8: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

column2: 21. This traffic sign warns you about:
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 22. When you change lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column8: look in the left side mirror.

column2: 23. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.
column6: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.
column8: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.

column2: 24. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns close to the center line.
25. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
column6: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.
column8: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
